summary.para: The namespace provides classes for working with watermarks in a document of any supported type.

The main classes in this namespace are:
is the entry point for watermarking process.
provides an easy way to customize caching, loging behaviour etc.
represents a watermark to be added to the content.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermark.IsBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the watermark should be placed at background.
member.value: If the value is true, the watermark will be placed at the bottom. By default, the value is false, the watermark will be placed at the top.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermark.Margins
member.summary: Gets or sets the margin settings of this .

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermark.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired height of this .
member.remarks: Setting this property will also change the value of property to .

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermark.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired width of this .
member.remarks: Setting this property will also change the value of property to .

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermark.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines how watermark size depends on parent size.
member.remarks: The value must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermark.SizingType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying a way watermark should be sized.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermark.ConsiderParentMargins
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the watermark size and coordinates are calculated considering parent margins.
member.value: If the value is true, watermark size and coordinates are calculated considering parent margins. By default, the value is false, parent margins are ignored.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermarks.Color.FromArgb(System.Int32,GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermarks.Color)
member.summary: Creates a structure from the specified structure, but with the new specified alpha value.
member.remarks: Although this method allows a 32-bit value to be passed for the alpha value, the value is limited to 8 bits.
member.param: The alpha value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
The from which to create the new .

member.exception: Alpha is less than 0 or greater than 255.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermarks.Color.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a structure from the specified 8-bit color values (red, green, and blue) and the alpha value is implicitly 255 (fully opaque).
member.remarks: Although this method allows a 32-bit value to be passed for each color component, the value of each component is limited to 8 bits.
member.param: The red component value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
The green component value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
The blue component value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
member.returns: The that this method creates.
member.exception: Red, green, or blue is less than 0 or greater than 255.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermarks.Color.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a structure from the four ARGB component (alpha, red, green, and blue) values.
member.remarks: Although this method allows a 32-bit value to be passed for each component, the value of each component is limited to 8 bits.
member.param: The alpha component value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
The red component value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
The green component value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
The blue component value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
member.returns: The that this method creates.
member.exception: Red, green, or blue is less than 0 or greater than 255.

member.summary: Specifies how margin values should be interpreted.

member.summary: Margin value measured in content units.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermarks.MarginType.RelativeToParentDimensions
member.summary: Margin value should be interpreted as a portion of appropriate parent dimension.
member.remarks: Left and right margins are relative to parent width, top and bottom margins are relative to parent height. If this type is chosen, margin value must be between 0.0 and 1.0.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Watermarks.MarginType.RelativeToParentMinDimension
member.summary: Margin value should be interpreted as a portion of parent minimum dimension.
member.remarks: If this type is chosen, margin value must be between 0.0 and 1.0.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Watermark.Contents.Pdf.PdfPermissions
member.summary: Represents user's permissions for a pdf document.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Contents.Pdf.PdfPermissions.PrintDocument
member.summary: Print the content.

remarks.para: Security handlers of revision 2: Print the content.
Security handlers of revision 3 or greater: Print the content (possibly not at the highest quality level, depending on whether is also set).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Contents.Pdf.PdfPermissions.ModifyContent
member.summary: Modify the content.
member.remarks: Modify the contents of the document by operations other than those controlled by , .

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Contents.Pdf.PdfPermissions.ExtractContent
member.summary: Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document.

remarks.para: Security handlers of revision 2: Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the content, including extracting text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).
Security handlers of revision 3 or greater: Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the content by operations other than that controlled by .

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Contents.Pdf.PdfPermissions.ModifyTextAnnotations
member.summary: Add or modify text annotations.
member.remarks: Add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive form fields, and, if is also set, create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Contents.Pdf.PdfPermissions.FillForm
member.summary: Fill in existing interactive form fields.
member.remarks: Security handlers of revision 3 or greater: Fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields), even if is clear.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Contents.Pdf.PdfPermissions.ExtractContentWithDisabilities
member.summary: Extract text and graphics.
member.remarks: Security handlers of revision 3 or greater: Extract text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Contents.Pdf.PdfPermissions.AssembleDocument
member.summary: Assemble the content.
member.remarks: Security handlers of revision 3 or greater: Assemble the content (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images), even if is clear.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Contents.Pdf.PdfPermissions.PrintingQuality
member.summary: Print the content to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF document could be generated.
member.remarks: Security handlers of revision 3 or greater: Print the content to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF document could be generated. When this bit is clear (and is set), printing is limited to a low-level representation of the appearance, possibly of degraded quality.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType
member.summary: Represents file type.
member.remarks:
This class provides methods to obtain list of all file types supported by GroupDocs.Watermark.
Learn more
Supported Document Formats
Get supported file formats
Get document info

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.Unknown
member.summary: Represents unknown file type.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.OOXML
member.summary: Office open xml file (.ooxml).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VSD
member.summary: VSD files are drawings created with Microsoft Visio application to represent variety of graphical objects and the interconnection between these. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VSDX
member.summary: Files with .VSDX extension represent Microsoft Visio file format introduced from Microsoft Office 2013 onwards. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VSS
member.summary: VSS are stencil files created with Microsoft Visio 2007 and earlier. Stencil files provide drawing objects that can be included in a .VSD Visio drawing. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VSSX
member.summary: Files with .VSSX extension are drawing stencils created with Microsoft Visio 2013 and above. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VSDM
member.summary: Files with VSDM extension are drawing files created with Microsoft Visio application that supports macros. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VST
member.summary: Files with VST extension are vector image files created with Microsoft Visio and act as template for creating further files. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VSTX
member.summary: Files with VSTX extensions are drawing template files created with Microsoft Visio 2013 and above. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VSTM
member.summary: Files with VSTM extension are template files created with Microsoft Visio that support macros. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VSSM
member.summary: Files with .VSSM extension are Microsoft Visio Stencil files that support provide support for macros. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VSX
member.summary: Files with .VSX extension refer to stencils that consist of drawings and shapes that are used for creating diagrams in Microsoft Visio. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VTX
member.summary: A file with VTX extension is a Microsoft Visio drawing template that is saved to disc in XML file format. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VDW
member.summary: VDW is the Visio Graphics Service file format that specifies the streams and storages required for rendering a Web drawing. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.VDX
member.summary: Any drawing or chart created in Microsoft Visio, but saved in XML format have .VDX extension. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.MSG
member.summary: MSG is a file format used by Microsoft Outlook and Exchange to store email messages, contact, appointment, or other tasks. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.EML
member.summary: EML file format represents email messages saved using Outlook and other relevant applications. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.EMLX
member.summary: The EMLX file format is implemented and developed by Apple. The Apple Mail application uses the EMLX file format for exporting the emails. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.OFT
member.summary: Files with .OFT extension represent message template files that are created using Microsoft Outlook. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.TIF
member.summary: TIFF or TIF, Tagged Image File Format, represents raster images that are meant for usage on a variety of devices that comply with this file format standard. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.TIFF
member.summary: TIFF or TIF, Tagged Image File Format, represents raster images that are meant for usage on a variety of devices that comply with this file format standard. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.JPG
member.summary: A JPEG is a type of image format that is saved using the method of lossy compression. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.JPEG
member.summary: A JPEG is a type of image format that is saved using the method of lossy compression. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.PNG
member.summary: PNG, Portable Network Graphics, refers to a type of raster image file format that use loseless compression. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.GIF
member.summary: A GIF or Graphical Interchange Format is a type of highly compressed image. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.BMP
member.summary: Files having extension .BMP represent Bitmap Image files that are used to store bitmap digital images. These images are independent of graphics adapter and are also called device independent bitmap (DIB) file format. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.JPF
member.summary: JPEG 2000 (JPF) is an image coding system and state-of-the-art image compression standard. Designed, using wavelet technology JPEG 2000 can code lossless content in any quality at once. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.JPX
member.summary: JPEG 2000 (JPX) is an image coding system and state-of-the-art image compression standard. Designed, using wavelet technology JPEG 2000 can code lossless content in any quality at once. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.JPM
member.summary: JPEG 2000 (JPM) is an image coding system and state-of-the-art image compression standard. Designed, using wavelet technology JPEG 2000 can code lossless content in any quality at once. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.WEBP
member.summary: WebP, introduced by Google, is a modern raster web image file format that is based on lossless and lossy compression. It provides same image quality while considerably reducing the image size. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.PDF
member.summary: Portable Document Format (PDF) is a type of document created by Adobe back in 1990s. The purpose of this file format was to introduce a standard for representation of documents and other reference material in a format that is independent of application software, hardware as well as Operating System. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.PPT
member.summary: A file with PPT extension represents PowerPoint file that consists of a collection of slides for displaying as SlideShow. It specifies the Binary File Format used by Microsoft PowerPoint 97-2003. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.PPTX
member.summary: Files with PPTX extension are presentation files created with popular Microsoft PowerPoint application. Unlike the previous version of presentation file format PPT which was binary, the PPTX format is based on the Microsoft PowerPoint open XML presentation file format. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.PPS
member.summary: PPS, PowerPoint Slide Show, files are created using Microsoft PowerPoint for Slide Show purpose. PPS file reading and creation is supported by Microsoft PowerPoint 97-2003. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.PPSX
member.summary: PPSX, Power Point Slide Show, file are created using Microsoft PowerPoint 2007 and above for Slide Show purpose. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.PPTM
member.summary: Files with PPTM extension are Macro-enabled Presentation files that are created with Microsoft PowerPoint 2007 or higher versions. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.POTX
member.summary: Files with .POTX extension represent Microsoft PowerPoint template presentations that are created with Microsoft PowerPoint 2007 and above. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.POTM
member.summary: Files with POTM extension are Microsoft PowerPoint template files with support for Macros. POTM files are created with PowerPoint 2007 or above and contains default settings that can be used to create further presentation files. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.PPSM
member.summary: Files with PPSM extension represent Macro-enabled Slide Show file format created with Microsoft PowerPoint 2007 or higher. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.XLS
member.summary: Files with XLS extension represent Excel Binary File Format. Such files can be created by Microsoft Excel as well as other similar spreadsheet programs such as OpenOffice Calc or Apple Numbers. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.XLSX
member.summary: XLSX is well-known format for Microsoft Excel documents that was introduced by Microsoft with the release of Microsoft Office 2007. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.XLSM
member.summary: Files with XLSM extension is a type of Spreasheet files that support Macros. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.XLTX
member.summary: Files with XLTX extension represent Microsoft Excel Template files that are based on the Office OpenXML file format specifications. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.XLTM
member.summary: The XLTM file extension represents files that are generated by Microsoft Excel as Macro-enabled template files. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.XLSB
member.summary: XLSB file format specifies the Excel Binary File Format, which is a collection of records and structures that specify Excel workbook content. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.XLT
member.summary: Files with .XLT extension are template files created with Microsoft Excel which is a spreadsheet application which comes as part of Microsoft Office suite. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.DOC
member.summary: Files with .doc extension represent documents generated by Microsoft Word or other word processing documents in binary file format. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.DOCX
member.summary: DOCX is a well-known format for Microsoft Word documents. Introduced from 2007 with the release of Microsoft Office 2007, the structure of this new Document format was changed from plain binary to a combination of XML and binary files. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.DOCM
member.summary: DOCM files are Microsoft Word 2007 or higher generated documents with the ability to run macros. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.DOT
member.summary: Files with .DOT extension are template files created by Microsoft Word to have pre-formatted settings for generation of further DOC or DOCX files. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.DOTX
member.summary: Files with DOTX extension are template files created by Microsoft Word to have pre-formatted settings for generation of further DOCX files. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.DOTM
member.summary: A file with DOTM extension represents template file created with Microsoft Word 2007 or higher. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.RTF
member.summary: Introduced and documented by Microsoft, the Rich Text Format (RTF) represents a method of encoding formatted text and graphics for use within applications. The format facilitates cross-platform document exchange with other Microsoft Products, thus serving the purpose of interoperability. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.ODT
member.summary: ODT files are type of documents created with word processing applications that are based on OpenDocument Text File format. These are created with word processor applications such as free OpenOffice Writer and can hold content such as text, images, objects and styles. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.FlatOpc
member.summary: Office Open XML WordprocessingML stored in a flat XML file instead of a ZIP package (.xml). Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.FlatOpcMacroEnabled
member.summary: Office Open XML WordprocessingML Macro-Enabled Document stored in a flat XML file instead of a ZIP package (.xml). Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.FlatOpcTemplate
member.summary: Office Open XML WordprocessingML Template (macro-free) stored in a flat XML file instead of a ZIP package (.xml). Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Watermark.Common.FileType.FlatOpcTemplateMacroEnabled
member.summary: Office Open XML WordprocessingML Macro-Enabled Template stored in a flat XML file instead of a ZIP package (.xml). Learn more about this file format here.
